trans-unit.source: Create an Internet Explorer Browser Window

seg-source.mrk: Create an Internet Explorer Browser Window

target.mrk: Create an Internet Explorer Browser Window

trans-unit.source: [optional] specifies the Url to navigate to upon creation

seg-source.mrk: specifies the Url to navigate to upon creation

target.mrk: specifies the Url to navigate to upon creation

trans-unit.source: [optional] specifies whether to try to attach to an existing window

seg-source.mrk: specifies whether to try to attach to an existing window

target.mrk: specifies whether to try to attach to an existing window

trans-unit.source: 1 = Try to attach to an existing window

seg-source.mrk: 1 = Try to attach to an existing window

target.mrk: 1 = Try to attach to an existing window

trans-unit.source: [optional] specifies whether the browser window will be visible

seg-source.mrk: specifies whether the browser window will be visible

target.mrk: specifies whether the browser window will be visible

trans-unit.source: [optional] specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

seg-source.mrk: specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

target.mrk: specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

trans-unit.source: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

seg-source.mrk: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

target.mrk: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

trans-unit.source: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

seg-source.mrk: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

target.mrk: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

trans-unit.source: [optional] specifies whether to bring the attached window to focus

seg-source.mrk: specifies whether to bring the attached window to focus

target.mrk: specifies whether to bring the attached window to focus

trans-unit.source: 0 = Do not bring window into focus

seg-source.mrk: 0 = Do not bring window into focus

target.mrk: 0 = Do not bring window into focus

trans-unit.source: an object variable pointing to an InternetExplorer.Application object.

seg-source.mrk: an object variable pointing to an InternetExplorer.

target.mrk: an object variable pointing to an InternetExplorer.

trans-unit.source: Set to true (1) or false (0) depending on the success of $iTryAttach

seg-source.mrk: Set to true (1) or false (0) depending on the success of $iTryAttach

target.mrk: Set to true (1) or false (0) depending on the success of $iTryAttach

trans-unit.source: When using tryAttach, a No Match error will be displayed to the console from _IEAttach().

seg-source.mrk: When using tryAttach, a No Match error will be displayed to the console from _IEAttach().

target.mrk: When using tryAttach, a No Match error will be displayed to the console from _IEAttach().

trans-unit.source: When opening a local HyperTextApplication (.hta) file, Internet Explorer will open a new browser process for it that will not be accessible through the object variable returned by _IECreate().

seg-source.mrk: When opening a local HyperTextApplication (.hta) file, Internet Explorer will open a new browser process for it that will not be accessible through the object variable returned by _IECreate().

target.mrk: When opening a local HyperTextApplication (.hta) file, Internet Explorer will open a new browser process for it that will not be accessible through the object variable returned by _IECreate().

trans-unit.source: To control this new browser you must use _IEAttach() with the "embedded" option.

seg-source.mrk: To control this new browser you must use _IEAttach() with the "embedded" option.

target.mrk: To control this new browser you must use _IEAttach() with the "embedded" option.

trans-unit.source: New security in Windows Vista causes a new browser window to be created when a browser is instructed to navigate to a URL in a different security zone.

seg-source.mrk: New security in Windows Vista causes a new browser window to be created when a browser is instructed to navigate to a URL in a different security zone.

target.mrk: New security in Windows Vista causes a new browser window to be created when a browser is instructed to navigate to a URL in a different security zone.

trans-unit.source: This occurs as well with the initial creation and navigation initiated with _IECreate().

seg-source.mrk: This occurs as well with the initial creation and navigation initiated with _IECreate().

target.mrk: This occurs as well with the initial creation and navigation initiated with _IECreate().

trans-unit.source: The new window is a new browser instance and the previous browser object variable no longer points to it.

seg-source.mrk: The new window is a new browser instance and the previous browser object variable no longer points to it.

target.mrk: The new window is a new browser instance and the previous browser object variable no longer points to it.

trans-unit.source: 1) add #RequireAdmin to your code (this is required even if the account is part of the Administrator's Group and will prompt for credentials if necessary),

seg-source.mrk: 1) add #RequireAdmin to your code (this is required even if the account is part of the Administrator's Group and will prompt for credentials if necessary),

target.mrk: 1) add #RequireAdmin to your code (this is required even if the account is part of the Administrator's Group and will prompt for credentials if necessary),

trans-unit.source: 2) use _IEAttach() to connect to the new browser window

seg-source.mrk: 2) use _IEAttach() to connect to the new browser window

target.mrk: 2) use _IEAttach() to connect to the new browser window

trans-unit.source: 3) add the target website to the Trusted Sites security zone in IE,

seg-source.mrk: 3) add the target website to the Trusted Sites security zone in IE,

target.mrk: 3) add the target website to the Trusted Sites security zone in IE,

trans-unit.source: or 5) disable UAC. Care must be taken to understand the implications of disabling IE security features when accessing untrusted sites.

seg-source.mrk: Care must be taken to understand the implications of disabling IE security features when accessing untrusted sites.

target.mrk: Care must be taken to understand the implications of disabling IE security features when accessing untrusted sites.
